poem:
Title: "A Plea Amidst The Shards of Silence"

On a page black with print and pain,
Each word a wound, each phrase a strain,
Israel, Gaza, caught in strife,
Two nations cleaved by the sword of life.
Echoes of war 'neath olive trees,
Asks humanity for its pleas,
A foreign court's grim, gavelled dance,
In the name of peace, we pray for- a chance.
